      • doInBackground

        protected java.lang.Boolean doInBackground(java.lang.Void... params)
        Since we are retrieving data from the database we need to do it asynchronously so it doesn't interfere with the app and with what the user is doing at the moment of retrieving the data.
        Specified by:
        doInBackground in class android.os.AsyncTask<java.lang.Void,java.lang.Void,java.lang.Boolean>
        Parameters:
        params - Void.
        Returns:
        Boolean array containing only one element, this is going to be used by the onPostExecute(final Boolean success) method.
        See Also:
        AsyncTask.onPreExecute(), AsyncTask.onPostExecute(Result), AsyncTask.publishProgress(Progress...)

      • onPostExecute

        protected void onPostExecute(java.lang.Boolean success)
        Whether the background process was executed successfully or not, this method is executed. Depending on the argument success different scenarios will be executed.
        Overrides:
        onPostExecute in class android.os.AsyncTask<java.lang.Void,java.lang.Void,java.lang.Boolean>
        Parameters:
        success - This parameter comes from the doInBackground(Void... params) method.
        See Also:
        AsyncTask.onPreExecute(), AsyncTask.doInBackground(Params...), AsyncTask.onCancelled(Object)

      • getName

        private java.lang.String getName(java.lang.String id)
        Basically this function just returns the name of the city.
        Parameters:
        id - This is the id of the City, based on that we can get the name of the city.
        Returns:
